title: Citrus Bacon Brussels Sprouts
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Citrus Bacon Brussels Sprouts a try. This recipe serves 6 and costs $1.14 per serving. One serving contains 234 calories, 6g of protein, and 9g of fat. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have chicken broth, orange, orange juice, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 1 hour. With a spoonacular score of 52%, this dish is pretty good. Try Mini Challenge: Grilled New York Strip Steak with Tennessee Drunken Braised Brussels Sprouts and Bacon Hash and a Spicy Caribbean Citrus Cinnamon Chutney, Citrus Carrots and Brussels Sprouts, and Citrus Caramelized Brussels Sprouts for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Fry the bacon over medium heat until barely crisp. Using kitchen scissors, snip the bacon into -inch pieces.                                                    Pour off all but 2 teaspoons fat from the pan.                                                    Add the shallots and saut until soft. Add the chicken broth, brown ale, orange juice and zest, and brown sugar and bring to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes on medium heat.                                                    Add the bacon and sprouts and cook for 10 minutes more, stirring frequently, until sprouts are coated with a thick sauce.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Fry the bacon over medium heat until barely crisp. Using kitchen scissors, snip the bacon into -inch pieces.
Pour off all but 2 teaspoons fat from the pan.
Add the shallots and saut until soft.
Add the chicken broth, brown ale, orange juice and zest, and brown sugar and bring to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes on medium heat.
Add the bacon and sprouts and cook for 10 minutes more, stirring frequently, until sprouts are coated with a thick sauce.
